did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The collection comprises material collected by Dorothy representing her line of the Amos Avery branch of the Groton Avery family. Material related to Oliver Perry Avery and his children figure prominently in the material that Clark gathered over the years.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Dorothy Crary Avery Clark (1920-2003) was born in Norwich, Connecticut, the daughter of Andrew Meech Avery (1884-1969), and Goldie Davis. Her father was descended from Amos Avery (1774-1840) and Dorothy Crary Avery (1759-1852) of Preston. Clark married George Pendleton Clark (1919-2007) in 1942. The couple lived in Ledyard and had two children, Delia Ellen Clark (born in 1949, lost at sea in 1987) and Carolyn Clark (1951-2011).

Avery family history was one of Dorothy Clark's interests, and material she collected related for the most part to her father Andrew Meech Avery's family. He had four half-siblings, Oliver Perry Avery (1871-1959). Delia Avery Southworth (1855-1910), Amos Avery (1868-1933) and Andrew Hewitt Avery (born and died 1876). Clark's collection has a number of items related to Oliver Perry Avery and his sons. (Dr.) Oliver Perry Avery was born in North Stonington, but spent most of his life outside of Connecticut as a Congregational pastor; he died in Claremont California. He had three children, Perry Dickinson Avery (1904-1990), R. Stanton Avery (1907-1997) and Martha Avery Vanderveen (1917-2013). R. Stanton Avery was the inventor of the self-sticking label and founded what became the Avery Dennison Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Dorothy Clark Collection includes original documents and photocopies related to the Amos Avery branch of the Groton Avery family. Much of the material relates to Oliver Perry Avery and his sons, Perry Dickinson Avery and R. Stanton Avery. Among the items are booklets on poetry and Preston cabinet makers, correspondence, a typed copy of Andrew Avery's diary, magazine articles by or about the Averys, particularly R. Stanton Avery, Avery International annual reports and newspaper clippings. It also includes information about the drowning of Delia Avery (1813-1849), daughter of Amos Avery, and a memorial book for Clark's mother, Goldie B. Avery.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Records are arranged in folders and housed in two boxes.

relatedmaterial.p: A Delia Avery Southworth drawing and a Delia Avery sampler are displayed on the wall in the upstairs master bedroom. An Amos Avery Bible is in a display case.
